results.title: Krull
results.creator_credit: Ron Silverman, Columbia Pictures and Peter Yates
results.brief_description: Set in the fantastic kingdom of Krull, our plot starts with the revelation that the kingdom is under threat from the indescribable Beast and his army of Slayers. Eager to forge an alliance, Prince Colwyn (Ken Marshall) and Princess Lyssa (Lysette Anthony) plan to marry. During the wedding ceremony however, slayers attack, killing Colwyn’s father and kidnapping Lyssa and taking her to the black fortress. Waking to discover he has lost his father and his bride, Colwyn is advised by the wise Ynyr that he must retrieve the Glaive - a starfish shaped, jewel encrusted symbol with retractable blades - which, given the right bearer, is the only thing that can defeat the Beast. Colwyn recruits a motley crew of renegades (including reputable actors such as Liam Neeson and Bernard Bresslaw), to accompany him on his quest. A curious blend of science fiction and medieval iconography, “Krull” has all the resident tenets of a fantasy; damsel in distress, love that can cure all evil, an almighty quest and final showdown between hero and villain. Whilst receiving a G classification, there are a few ghoulish moments which belie the general rating. Made on a budget in excess of 45 million, the film received cult rather than commercial success. Written by Stanford Sherman.

results.title: KRO Germany
results.creator_credit: Crown Film Unit and Junge Film Union
results.brief_description: This film, which was produced by The British Central Office of Information for the Control Commission of the British zone of postwar Germany, shows the daily life of a Kreis Resident Officer (the Control Commission Officer in charge of a German Kreis or district). The KRO is seen dealing with the day-to-day difficulties which arise, showing how they are tackled, and what problems have yet to be solved.

results.title: Krasner, Norman...beloved husband of Irma
results.brief_description: A film without dialogue employing the universal language of comedy to capture the tribulations of a man attempting to use a pay toilet. Written by James Herbert. Cast includes Douglas Macintosh, David Thompson and David Kelly.

results.title: Kramer vs. Kramer [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Stanley R. Jaffe, Columbia Pictures and Robert Benton
results.brief_description: A sensitive drama revolving around the relationship between a single father and his young son. Dustin Hoffman plays Ted Kramer, a career-driver husband and father who returns home from work one evening to be told by his wife (Meryl Streep) that she is leaving him and their six year old son. Initially overwhelmed by the responsibility of juggling a career and the care of his son, he gradually adapts to the role of single parent. When his wife returns after a period of soul searching, Ted challenges her right to custody. Based on the novel by Avery Corman. Also stars Justin Henry and Jane Alexander. Cinematography by Nestor Almendros. (Academy Awards: Best picture, Best actor, Best supporting actress, Best cinematography, Best direction, Best screenplay)

results.title: Krakonos, the Mountain King and the Cobbler
results.brief_description: Animated puppet film concerning a cobbler’s wife who is saddened by the roguish antics of her husband. When the cobbler steals a goat and incurs the wrath of an angry farmer his wife appeals to Krakonos the Mountain King for help. Krakonos changes the cobbler into a scarecrow until he repents of his evil ways.

results.title: Krakonos and the ghost (K)
results.brief_description: Animated film with puppets. When the village is threatened by a mysterious ghost that robs those it frightens, Krakonos the Mountain King decides to investigate. Suspecting the ghost is phoney Krakonos lays a trap.

results.title: Krakonos and Matty the Glassman
results.brief_description: Animated puppet story about Matty, a poor glassmaker, who vows to marry his sweetheart Cordelia when he gains some money. On the way to the market Matty stops to drink with a friend and loses his wares. Angry at Matty for his recklessness, Cordelia calls on Krakonos the Mountain King to devise a test for Matty so he can prove his worth.

results.title: Krakonos and Marquardt the Governor
results.brief_description: Animated fairytale about a wicked father who locks his daughter Viola in a tower when she refuses to marry an old Count. Viola’s handsome suitor fails in his attempts to rescue her until Krakonos the Mountain King comes to the rescue.
